metadata.Title: CVE-2019-3462 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Incorrect sanitation of the 302 redirect field in HTTP transport method of apt versions 1.4.8 and earlier can lead to content injection by a MITM attacker, potentially leading to remote code execution on the target machine.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-3462` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apt - 1.6.6ubuntu0.1
apt-transport-https - 1.6.6ubuntu0.1
apt-utils - 1.6.6ubuntu0.1
libapt-inst2.0 - 1.6.6ubuntu0.1
libapt-pkg5.0 - 1.6.6ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.6ubuntu0.1').
